attributes.action: Enforce CMS payments for a voluntarily unemployed non-custodial parent.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of non-custodial parents in the UK are voluntarily remaining unemployed to avoid making child support payments.
attributes.background: Give a court the power to use imputed income for a non-custodial parent if they are purposely lowering their income or remaining unemployed for the sole purpose of lowering or avoiding making child support payments to the custodial parent.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Child Maintenance can already be calculated on amounts other than employment income:

https://www.gov.uk/how-child-maintenance-is-worked-out/ask-other-income-expenses-included

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
